summary: Every year we audit the federal debt. (As of Sept. 30, 2018, it was a little more than $21.5 trillion.) This year our audit found new weaknesses in the security of the information systems that the Treasury Department uses to keep track of and otherwise manage the debt. These new weaknesses, along with some unresolved earlier ones, could lead to an increased risk of unauthorized...
title: Management Report: Improvements Needed in the Bureau of the Fiscal Service's Information System Controls
topics: Consolidated Financial Statements of the U.S. Government
